oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Letter from W.F Goodwin to the Lookout Shop
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Letter from Private W.F. Goodwin to the Lookout Shop. In the letter he expresses gratitude towards a fireplace broom he received, mentions work for a metal craftsman and inquires about something nice for a young lady confined to her bed.

Margaret Croft owned part of the Lookout Shop and was involved in its day-to-day business affairs until she sold her shares in 1945. The shop was opened by Arlene Ziegler and Mable Ward in 1939 as a store featuring arts and crafts from Southern artists. The pair sold the shop when they retired in 1953. Ward and Ziegler were also the founders of Nashville's iconic Satsuma Tea Room, which operated from 1918-2001.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Goodwin, W. F.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Correspondence; Stores, Retail--Tennessee; Craft shops
